cs213.photoAlbum.control

Class Control

  • java.lang.Object
    • cs213.photoAlbum.control.Control
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PhotoSource

    public class Control
extends java.lang.Object
implements PhotoSource
    Class serves as a bridge between the View and Model. The view can call methods on the control object to influence the model. All method descriptions are provided in the PhotoSource interface.
    Author:
    Karan Kadaru

      Public constructor.

    • Method Detail

      • setCurrentUser

        public void setCurrentUser(java.lang.String userid)
        Description copied from interface: PhotoSource
        Method sets the current user. View would call this when the user logs in, and it defines what user the control object will be operating upon for the rest of the session.
        Specified by:
        setCurrentUser in interface PhotoSource
        Parameters:
        userid - The id of the current user.

      • loadUserData

        public boolean loadUserData()
        Description copied from interface: PhotoSource
        Method is called after setCurrentUser, and de-serializes the user data and loads it into memory. Should be called directly after setCurrentUser, and before all other interactive methods.
        Specified by:
        loadUserData in interface PhotoSource
        Returns:
        Whether or not the operation was successful.

      • shutdown

        public boolean shutdown()
        Description copied from interface: PhotoSource
        Method is responsible for writing the current user out to disk and doing anything else that needs to be done for a clean shutdown.
        Specified by:
        shutdown in interface PhotoSource
        Returns:
        Whether or not the operation was successful.
